definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He certified it was his wife‘s handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 他證明那是他妻子的手跡。

sentences.english: This is the script of Harriet.
Mr. Xin Shuzhi's original manuscript of an outline of the Chinese and foreign science laws has been found recently.
sentences.chinese: 辛樹幟先生論中外科學大律提綱手跡新近發現。

sentences.english: Graphology is the study of how a person's handwriting reveals his or her personality traits.
sentences.chinese: 筆跡學，是指通過某人的手跡揭示出此人的性格特點。

sentences.english: This antithetical couplet hanging in the library was written by Lu Hsun.
sentences.chinese: 圖書館牆上這幅字跡蒼遒的對聯，正是魯迅的手跡。

sentences.english: This is a horizontal inscribed board of Huan-Presbyterian original handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 匾額是本煥長老的手跡。

sentences.english: Dr. Sun's original handwriting in 1897 - manuscript of his autobiography .
sentences.chinese: 這是孫中山先生寫於1897年的自傳手跡。

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Guo2 jia1 Bo2 wu4 guan3

definition: short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
to write the title of a book on a label
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
to comment/a point by point commentary
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view

Prime tortoise of the record bureau, Song dynasty historical encyclopedia of political essays, autobiography, memorials and decrees, compiled 1005-1013 under Wang Qinruo 王欽若|王钦若 and Yang Yi 楊億|杨亿, 1000 scrolls
